events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred yesterday afternoon at the intersection. They filed the claim promptly with initial details provided.
After reviewing the initial claim, the case was categorized under Auto Accident due to reported vehicle collision and damage.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to assist the customer with their vehicle collision case and to guide the process forward.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and assured the customer that support would be provided promptly.
The agent requested photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and a copy of the driver’s license to proceed with the investigation.
Customer submitted all requested documents including detailed images of the damaged vehicle and official police collision report.
The investigation into the accident circumstances was initiated to determine liability and extent of vehicle damage.
Investigation finalized confirming the other driver was at fault; damages assessed and claim deemed valid for coverage.
A settlement amount covering the repair costs was proposed to the customer for approval based on the investigation findings.
The customer promptly responded expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciation for the quick handling.
The claim was officially approved in accordance with company policies, moving next toward payment disbursal.
Payment covering the agreed settlement amount was issued to the customer’s account to cover repair costs.
The claim was officially closed after payment disbursement with all documentation completed and customer notified.
The case files and correspondence related to the auto accident claim were archived for record-keeping and future reference.
